techmeme.title: A profile of Carlos Espina, who has 9.4M TikTok followers, posts in Spanish about immigration and politics, and whom the White House treats as a broadcaster (New York Times)
Microsoft says it fixed a configuration issue causing Microsoft 365 apps and services outage and restored several services; some services remain degraded (Simon Sharwood/The Register)
Netflix added 8M subscribers in Q2 vs. 5M est., as it benefited from a crackdown on password-sharing and popular titles like Bridgerton and Baby Reindeer (Reuters)
CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz says "the issue has been identified, isolated and a fix has been deployed", and CrowdStrike is working with impacted customers (George Kurtz/@george_kurtz)
Bangladesh orders a nationwide shutdown of its mobile internet amid student protests that killed dozens of people to "ensure the security of citizens" (Daryna Antoniuk/The Record)
